result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ravon Collins

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Status Report 10-10-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.5.22
Court rescheduled plea/sentencing hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
received and filed.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 07-12-2022
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Jason Findling
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION, same terms and conditions.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Ravon Collins not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Attorney Smith informs Court that case will be administratively transferred to Attorney Jason Findling.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 5-28-2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defenders Office and District Attorney.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court via zoom.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Status conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court took no action on bail.

Defendant Ravon Collins in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.   Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ravon Collins in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ravon Collins in court in person with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith who appears by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Grap. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Ravon Collins in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Ravon Collins in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ravon Collins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ravon Collins
Current: 4311 North 19th St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 01-09-2022)
Prior: 1822 North 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
